page.title: 11Transport
page.content: Transport is mainly the large bus service and the railway station.The bus station is situated in the middle of Accngton near the market.It is run mainly by Hyndburn buses but Ribble buses have a share in it as well.The train station is situated out of the block but is another major part in transport.The major roads are roads such as Manchester,Blackburn and Burnley which all lead out of Accrington.Manchester road is one of the large important roads and was built by John Metcalfe in the 1790's.There were turn pikes at church lane ends and Grange bridge but the tall houses have vanished.The only surviving example is the "Bar House" in Oak Hill Park which dates from the 19th century.When the roads are being repaired you can sometimes see the old tramlines underneath.
